name.japanese: フィッシャー・タイガー

keyMoments.title: Fisher Tiger Introduced as the Liberator of Mary Geoise
keyMoments.description: Fisher Tiger is introduced through Hancock's flashback as the legendary fish-man who climbed the Red Line with his bare hands, attacked Mary Geoise, and freed all the slaves including the Boa sisters. Despite his hatred of humans, he freed everyone without discrimination.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Fisher Tiger as one of the most heroic figures in One Piece history and explains how Hancock and her sisters escaped slavery. This moment sets up his full backstory arc that will be explored in detail during the Fish-Man Island arc.
keyMoments.quote: One day, a fish-man appeared. His name was Fisher Tiger.

statusHistory.note: Fisher Tiger died years before the main storyline, as revealed later
Died from blood loss after refusing human blood transfusion

bounties.reason: Attacking Mary Geoise and freeing slaves

abilities.description: Master of Fish-Man Karate, able to manipulate water and deliver devastating strikes.
As a fish-man, possesses strength ten times that of a human. Climbed the Red Line with bare hands.

relationships.description: Fisher Tiger freed Hancock and her sisters from slavery at Mary Geoise. Hancock considers this an unpayable debt.

evolutionMoments.description: Hancock reveals Fisher Tiger freed her from slavery and she owes him everything.

relationships.description: Fisher Tiger freed Sandersonia from slavery at Mary Geoise.
Fisher Tiger freed Marigold from slavery at Mary Geoise.

reveals.information: Climbed the Red Line and attacked Mary Geoise to free slaves
Despite hating humans for his own suffering, freed human and fish-man slaves without discrimination
Founded the Sun Pirates and created their sun symbol to cover slave brands

keyMoments.title: Reveals the Hoof of the Celestial Dragon
keyMoments.description: Hancock reveals the slave brand on her back - the Hoof of the Soaring Dragon - proving she was enslaved by the Celestial Dragons and that the Gorgon legend was a lie.
keyMoments.significance: This is the defining reveal of Hancock's character, explaining all of her behavior and trauma. It transforms her from antagonist to deeply sympathetic character.
keyMoments.quote: This mark... it is the greatest shame of our lives. The Hoof of the Celestial Dragon.

keyMoments.title: Reveals Enslavement at Age Twelve
keyMoments.description: Hancock confesses she was kidnapped and enslaved at age twelve on her first voyage with the Kuja Pirates.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the root trauma that shaped Hancock's entire personality and worldview.
keyMoments.quote: We were only twelve years old... just children when those monsters took us.

keyMoments.title: Hancock's Love Confession to Luffy
keyMoments.description: After receiving Luffy's compassionate response to her trauma, Hancock admits she likes Luffy - the first time she has had romantic feelings for a man.
keyMoments.significance: This establishes Hancock's defining character trait going forward - her love for Luffy - and marks her transformation from antagonist to devoted ally.

reveals.information: Was enslaved by the Celestial Dragons from age 12 to 16
Was freed by Fisher Tiger when he raided Mary Geoise
Was force-fed the Mero Mero no Mi by her Celestial Dragon captors for their entertainment
The Gorgon legend is a lie created to hide the shame of slavery
Her arrogant persona is a defense mechanism to keep people from discovering her past
Develops romantic feelings for Luffy after he shows compassion for her past

relationships.description: Hancock falls in love with Luffy after he shows unconditional acceptance of her traumatic past and declares he only hates the Celestial Dragons who enslaved her.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy passes Hancock's test by choosing to save the petrified women over his own escape, showing his selfless nature.
After revealing her slave past, Luffy responds with compassion, causing Hancock to fall for him.

relationships.description: Fisher Tiger freed Hancock from slavery. She states she owes him a debt she can never repay.

name.japanese: ボア・サンダーソニア

keyMoments.title: Reveals the Slave Brand
keyMoments.description: Sandersonia reveals the Hoof of the Celestial Dragon on her back, proving she was enslaved alongside her sisters.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that all three Boa sisters share the same traumatic past and slave brand.

keyMoments.title: Visible Trauma Response
keyMoments.description: As Hancock tells the story of their enslavement, Sandersonia visibly shakes, sweats, and shows extreme distress, reliving the trauma of those four years.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the lasting psychological impact of the torture and abuse they suffered under the Celestial Dragons.

reveals.information: Was enslaved by the Celestial Dragons from age 12 to 16 alongside her sisters
Was force-fed the Hebi Hebi no Mi, Model: Anaconda by the Celestial Dragons
Still suffers visible trauma responses when recalling the slavery experience

relationships.description: Fisher Tiger freed Sandersonia from slavery at Mary Geoise.

name.japanese: ボア・マリーゴールド

keyMoments.title: Reveals the Slave Brand
keyMoments.description: Marigold reveals the Hoof of the Celestial Dragon on her back, proving she was enslaved alongside her sisters.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that all three Boa sisters share the same traumatic past and slave brand.

keyMoments.title: Shares in the Traumatic Memory
keyMoments.description: As Hancock tells the story, Marigold shows visible distress alongside Sandersonia, demonstrating the shared trauma of their enslavement.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the lasting psychological impact of the torture and abuse they suffered under the Celestial Dragons.

reveals.information: Was enslaved by the Celestial Dragons from age 12 to 16 alongside her sisters
Was force-fed the Hebi Hebi no Mi, Model: King Cobra by the Celestial Dragons

relationships.description: Fisher Tiger freed Marigold from slavery at Mary Geoise.

keyMoments.title: Chooses Friends Over Escape
keyMoments.description: When tested by Hancock, Luffy immediately chooses to restore the petrified Kuja women over securing his own escape from Amazon Lily, demonstrating his selfless character.
keyMoments.significance: This decision proves Luffy's moral character to Hancock and earns her trust, setting up her confession and their future alliance.
keyMoments.quote: Turn them back! I don't care about the ship, just turn them back to normal!

keyMoments.title: Shows Unconditional Compassion to Hancock
keyMoments.description: After learning about Hancock's enslavement, Luffy declares he only hates the Celestial Dragons who enslaved her, not Hancock herself, showing complete acceptance without pity or judgment.
keyMoments.significance: This compassionate response causes Hancock to fall in love with Luffy and transforms their relationship from adversarial to one of deep trust and devotion.
keyMoments.quote: I don't hate you. The only ones I hate are the Celestial Dragons!

relationships.description: Luffy earns Hancock's complete trust and devotion through his selfless actions and compassionate response to her traumatic past. Hancock falls in love with him.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy passes Hancock's test by choosing to save the petrified women.
Luffy shows compassion for Hancock's slave past, causing her to trust and love him.
